meaningMnemonic: You're sewing something with <radical>thread</radical> but you and your creation get <radical>frostbite</radical> while you're still working. Luckily the snowflakes freeze themselves into the cloth and turn into a pretty <kanji>design</kanji>. They swirl around and press a unique snowy design into the fabric. This is nice for you because you can't sew anymore with your frostbitten hands.
readingMnemonic: As you watch the snowflake <kanji>design</kanji> form you see letters appearing in the corner! They form the name <reading>Aya</reading> (あや), our artist here at WaniKani. Somehow she's magically putting together this beautiful pattern!
